comment.author: 46650209@N07
comment._content:
Interesting photo.
I've always been interested in Ireland's military history, in particular in the interwar period and during The Emergency.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/patrick_castelli] Will bear that in mind, Patrick, and see what we can dig up for you...

comment.author: 87946161@N03
comment._content:
This is a picture of my Grandfather Lewis James Thomas with my gran, auntie Olive and uncle Richard, my mother is not in the photo as she was camera shy.
my grandfather died in Japanese prisoner war camp just before the end of the war.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/87946161@N03] How did you ever come across this photo? What amazing information, thank you! We had E. J. Thomas as that's how the photo appeared in the Irish Independent so it's great to have Lewis James. It's sad that your grandfather died so soon after this. Do you know how long he was stationed on Spike Island?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 55333592@N02
comment._content: Picture taken at Baths Quay Cobh

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sailcork] Thanks very much! Added to tags now.

comment.author: 87946161@N03
comment._content: On October 5th 2012 we were treated to a visit to Spike Island by the lovely staff from the Heritage Center  Cobh. It was the first time my mother and my Uncle Richard had gone back to Spike since the photo was taken.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/87946161@N03] Thanks for coming back to us again. It must have been very strange to be back there after so long. Was your mother younger or older than Richard and Olive?

P.S. you never told us your gran's name...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
